Uses of Class
mangan.Coordinates

  • Packages that use Coordinates 
    Package Description
    mangan  

    • Uses of Coordinates in mangan

      Methods in mangan that return Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Coordinates Coordinates.add(Coordinates addition)
      To add two Coordinates objects to each other.
      Coordinates Coordinates.addVelocity(Coordinates velocity)
      Adder for the velocity x and y.
      Coordinates Coordinates.divide(int divisor)
      To divide two Coordinates with each other.
      Coordinates Robot.move()
      The next movement of the robot is set from future to past, it returns the future to the simulator, and keeps track of the total distance traveled by the robot.
      Coordinates Coordinates.multiply(double product)
      To multiply two Coordinates by each other.
      Coordinates Coordinates.setVelocity(Coordinates velocity)
      Setter for the velocity x and y.
      Coordinates Coordinates.sub(Coordinates substraction)
      To subtract two Coordinates from each other.
      Coordinates Robot.think(java.util.List<Coordinates> neighbors, double weight1, double weight2, double weight3)
      Think gets the relative coordinates of the neighbors and calculates three ways of future movement following PSO algorithms of cohesion (alg1), separation (alg2) and alignment (alg3) explained in each of them.
      Methods in mangan that return types with arguments of type Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<Coordinates> Simulator.getNeighbors(Coordinates rob, int key)
      Given one robot, checks which robots are within the RADIUS distance and keeps the list of coordinates neighbors, with the relative positions of those respect the robot checked, so the information is able to be sent to the robot as if it was its own radar.
      static java.util.List<Coordinates> Simulator.getRobotsLocations()
      Returns all Coordinate objects of the robots currently stored as a List object.
      Methods in mangan with parameters of type Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Coordinates Coordinates.add(Coordinates addition)
      To add two Coordinates objects to each other.
      Coordinates Coordinates.addVelocity(Coordinates velocity)
      Adder for the velocity x and y.
      static double Simulator.getMangan(Coordinates rob)
      Calculates the mangan around the new position of the robot and collects it.
      static java.util.List<Coordinates> Simulator.getNeighbors(Coordinates rob, int key)
      Given one robot, checks which robots are within the RADIUS distance and keeps the list of coordinates neighbors, with the relative positions of those respect the robot checked, so the information is able to be sent to the robot as if it was its own radar.
      void Coordinates.setCoords(Coordinates setCord)
      Setter for objects with coordinates.
      Coordinates Coordinates.setVelocity(Coordinates velocity)
      Setter for the velocity x and y.
      Coordinates Coordinates.sub(Coordinates substraction)
      To subtract two Coordinates from each other.
      Method parameters in mangan with type arguments of type Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Coordinates Robot.think(java.util.List<Coordinates> neighbors, double weight1, double weight2, double weight3)
      Think gets the relative coordinates of the neighbors and calculates three ways of future movement following PSO algorithms of cohesion (alg1), separation (alg2) and alignment (alg3) explained in each of them.
